gurmukhi: hwr cly giH Awpny kau bn mo bhuqo iqn iDAwn lgwey ] is`D smwD AgwD kQw mun Koj rhY hir hwQ n Awey ]
transliteration: Haar Chale Grah(i) Aapane Kau Ban Mo Bahouto Tin Dhiaan Lagade|| Siddh Sdamaadh Agaddh Kathaa Mounndkhoj Rahai Har(i) Haath Na Aae||
translation: Those who meditate in the forest, they ultimately, getting tired, come back to their homes; the adepts and the sages have been seeking the Lord through contemplation, but that Lord could not be realised by anyone;

gurmukhi: sXwm BnY sB kqybn sMqn ky miq XO Thrwey ] BwKq hY kib sMq suno ijh pRym kIey iqn sRIpiq pwey ]2488]
transliteration: Syaam Bhanai Sabh Bed Kateban Santan Ke Mat(i) Yau Thahraae|| Bhaakhat Hai Kabi Sant Souno Jih Prem Keee Tin Sreepat(i) Paae||2488||
translation: All the Vedas, Katebs (Semitic Scriptures) and the saints say this that whosoever has loved the Lord, he has realized Him.2488.

gurmukhi: CqRI ko pUq hO bwmn ko nih kY qpu Awvq hY ju kro ] Aru Aaur jMjwr ijqo giH ko quih iqAwg khw icq qw mY Dro ]
transliteration: Chhatriko Poott Hau Baamanndko Nah(i) Nah(i) Kai Tap(u) Aavat Hai Judaro|| Ar(u) Aur Janjaar Jito Grah(i) Ko Tuhe Tiaag Kahaa Chit Taa Mai Daro||
translation: I am the son of a Kshatriya and not of a Brahmin who may instruct for performing severe austerities; how can I absorb myself in the embarrassments of the world by leaving you;

gurmukhi: Ab rIJ kY dyhu vhY hm kau joaU hau ibnqI kr jor kro ] jb Awau kI AauD indwn bnY AiqhI rn mY qb jUJ mro ]2489]
transliteration: Ab Reejh Kai Dehu Vahai Ham Kau Jooo Hau Bintikar Jordaro|| Jab Aau Kiaudh Nidaan Banai At(i)hiran Mai Tab Joojhdaro||
translation: Whatever request I am making with my folded hands, O Lord ! kindly be graceful and bestow this boon on me that when ever my end comes, then I may die fighting in the battlefield.2489.

gurmukhi: s`qH sY pYqwl mih swvn suid iQiq dIp ] ngr pwNvtw suB krn jmnw bhY smIp ]2490]
transliteration: Sattrah Sai Paitaal Maih Saavan Sud(i) Thit(i) Deep|| Nagad Paanvtaa Soubh Karan Jamnaa Bahai Sameep||2490||
translation: In the year 1745 of the Vikrami era in the Sudi aspect of the moon in the month of Sawan, in the town of Paonta at the auspicious hour, on banks of the flowing Yamuna; (this work has been completed).2490.

gurmukhi: dsm kQw Bwgauq kI BwKw krI bnwie ] Avr bwsnw nwih pRB Drm ju`D ky cwie ]2491]
transliteration: Dasam Kathaa Bhaagaddd Kibhaakhaa Karibanaae|| Avar Baasnaa Naah(i) Prabh Dharam Juddh Ke Chaae||2491||
translation: I have composed the discourse of the tenth part (Skandh) of Bhagavat in the vernacular; O Lord ! I have no other desire and have only the zeal for the war fought on the basis of righteousness.2491.

gurmukhi: DMn jIE iqh ko jg mY muK qy hir ic`q mY juDu ibcwrY ] dyh Ain`q n in`q rhY jsu nwv cVY Bvswgr qwrY ]
transliteration: Dhann Jeeo Tih Ko Jag Mai Moukh Te Har(i) Chitt Mai Judh(u) Bichdarai|| Deh Anitt Na Nitt Rahai Jas(u) Naav Chadai Bhavsaagad Tdarai||
translation: Bravo to the soul of that person, who remembers the Lord through his mouth and reflects in his mind about the war of righteousness; who considers this body the war of righteousness; who considers this body as transient, ascends the boat of Lordsâ€™ praise a

gurmukhi: DIrj Dwm bnwie iehY qn bu`iD su dIpk ijau aujIAwrY ] gXwnih kI bFnI mnhu hwQ lY kwqrqw kuqvwr buhwrY ]2492]
transliteration: Dheeraj Dhaam Banaae Ihai Tan Buddh(i) Su Deepak Jio Ujeedarai|| Gyaanah(i) Kibadhanimanoh Haath Lai Kaatarta Koutvaar Buhdarai||2492||
translation: Who makes this body as the abode of forbearance and enlightens it with the lamp of intellect and who taking the broom of knowledge in his hand sweeps away the rubbish of cowardice.2492.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI dsm iskMD purwxy bicqR nwtky gRMQy kiRSnwvqwry DXwie smwpqm squ suBm squ ]21]
transliteration: It(i) Sridasam Sikandh Puraane Bachitra Naatke Granthe Krishnaavatdare Dhyaae Samaaptam Sat(u) Soubham Sat(u)||21
translation: End of the concluding auspicious Chapter of Krishnavatara (based on Dasham Skandh Purana) in Bachittar Natak.21.
The Lord is one and He can be attained through the Grace of the True Guru.
